channel.title: Blogs on Foodieglobetrotter
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Foodieglobetrotter

item.title: How to make stuffed peppers with tuna! EASY RECIPE!
item.description: Have a look at my new #1min-recipe for stuffed peppers. Inspired from the book “Ouzo & Mezes” by Panagiotis Alexopoulos and Anastasia Zarboni. Enjoy!

item.title: New country, new rules
item.description: Switzerland is like heaven, so beautiful you will wish to stay and enjoy every moment. In terms of where we are staying (canton Valais), I cannot begin to describe how happy we are.

item.title: 6 month passport "rule" really a problem?
item.description: This is a question that will only cross your mind if you’re about to travel and realize that you have 6 months or less left on your passport.

item.title: Growing up
item.description: Truth is, I’m still getting to know me and learning to love what I see. I chose to write about some bits of my life as I think it is a part of me that made me who I am today.

item.title: Escape to Santorini
item.description: Dear Santorini, you are like a woman who knows she has it all and the world is at her feet. Yet, we cant help but fall in love with you.

item.title: Kimolos, Greek island deserving of praise!
item.description: We only went to Kimolos because we were invited to one of Sar’s good friends wedding! We were so thankful to be invited, as that weekend ended up being a great one!

item.title: Vietnam opened my eyes
item.description: I feel like I did not do justice to our trip in Vietnam. It was the best one month of my life and I spent it with my best friends Jun and Jonas and a friend I met while travelling Cambodia, Lukas!

item.title: Love from South Korea-famous for Gangnam Style!
item.description: I have not visited either of the Korea’s yet but one of my close friends Luis, travels so much for work he decided that he will be sending me pictures from his travels to add to my love for food.

item.title: Chinese brunch-Dim sums anyone?
item.description: You know what I am craving for most? DIM SUMS! A typical Asian-Cantonese brunch is called “yum cha” in Hong Kong which are dim sums served with chinese tea.

item.title: LEAVING TIME by Jodi Picoult
item.description: This is my first read of the summer! Lets just say it left tears in my eyes when I was done. Once again you’re given four peoples perspective in the story:

item.title: Favourite brunch spot in Cork-Perry's Street
item.description: Sar and I come here often and I think we’ve ordered the same thing several times (roast chicken and warm black pudding salad). Would that be boring?

item.title: Weekend shenanigans
item.description: We spent Saturday in Killarney catching up with friends from my university. I was never very good with goodbyes despite the time spent apart, I always feel this little bit of sadness.

item.title: Nasi goreng with tofu, mushrooms, vegetables served with fried egg
item.description: Nasi goreng in english would mean fried rice. So, you would have definitely tried this dish if you have ordered Malaysian fried rice before. Today was the kind of day that we were craving for food from my home.

item.title: Smoked salmon, high fiber scone with low fat yogurt and parsley
item.description: This is one of my favourite meals to make! I got the recipe for high fiber scones from odlums. Its very simple and easy to make and only takes 20 minutes of your time!

item.title: SMALL GREAT THINGS by Jodi Picoult
item.description: I was hooked from the very first page. This book looks at 3 peopleâ€™s perspective on racism. It involves: an African American nurse, a neo-nazi and his wife who loses their baby and blame the nurse for what happened and how they take her to court for murder and the nurse is represented by a white American lawyer who refuses to discuss racism as defense in a court room.

item.title: Grilled salmon,red lentil pasta with rosso pesto & a sprinkle of parmesan served with classic caesar salad
item.description: So since I have all the time on my hands I decided to start making new dishes and decide how complementary flavors can get on my own (although I am sure there are books out there!
